problem_text: We say that a family of groups D discriminates a group G if for any finite subset {a1, . . . , an} ⊆ G \ {1} there exists a group D ∈ D and a homomorphism φ : G → D such that ajφ ≠ 1 for all j = 1, . . . , n. Is every finitely generated group acting freely on some Λ-tree discriminated by torsion-free hyperbolic groups? G. Baumslag, A. G. Myasnikov, V. N. Remeslennikov
